content.description: This is an easy route to the top of Lower Deviation. Follow the easiest line up, approximately following the gully to the right of the summit block. This is a good way to tick another summit after doing the Sunset or First Flatiron.
content.protection: There isn't much pro, maybe bring a standard light rack.
content.location: Follow the gully to the right of the summit block on the east face. Scramble down to the north.

content.description:
This face looks fun but the rock is friable and it is scary if you're expecting a friendly continuation of the 3rd Flatiron.  There is virtually no protection.

In general, the farther right you are on this face, the easier it is.

Eds. note, the rating has been changed to reflect input from climbers below.
content.protection: Very little is available.  There is a piton ~75 feet up.
content.location: For the standard route, start in the middle of the face and follow a ramp up and right, then back left to the summit.
